content.description: Straight up the arete on good edges.
content.location: The tall, low angle northwest arete a few boulders east of the Extremist.

content.description: Sit start on good hole/dish and move up on sidepulls/slopers. Finish a bit up and right. Wonderful moves!
content.location: Around to the right from the Street Side arete.

content.description: Start as for Street Side but move out right to finish. Not quite as tall as Street Side, but not as secure or high quality, either.

content.location: Between on the way to South Street from the Extremist.

content.description: Sit-start on jugs on the left side of the overhang and climb the steep face on good incuts.  The jug at the top flexes quite a bit, so tread lightly as you pull to the lip of the boulder.
content.location: Ocean's 11 calls this area "The Owl Farm", it's off to the left as you come down the trail to the Yard.

content.description:
The Banks' guide gives this V6. I still haven't quite sent, but I have all but one move dialed, and I think it is hard as nails for V6. I'm reluctant to up the grade before sending, but just fair warning: this is no gimme.

The crux seems to be grabbing a small, knobby 2-3 finger crimp and then the move afterward to a nice edge.

To me there looks to be evidence of foothold breakage, but you never know. Maybe the old SB crew were just total badasses and campused off of two finger crimps. I'd believe it.
content.protection: One pad is sufficient. Though if you're just working the hard bits, you're a foot off the ground and you don't even need one.
content.location: Sit start on the "smile crimp" just right of the tree and head up right to join South Street.

climbs.name: The Font Problem (aka See Ya at the Yard Meat)

content.description: A 100% sloper problem, sit start with a right hand on a good but oddly shaped hold and a left on a knob and slap your way to the top. Excellent!
content.location: From the main trail split left past the Great Shark Hunt Boulder and follow the trail until you see Shoehorn, this problem is only the boulder directly to the left (towards the ocean). If you get to the Extremist boulder of the Borg boulder you've gone too far
